FreeViewing package¶

Submodules¶

FreeViewing.Viewings module¶

class FreeViewing.Viewings.Viewing(path)[source]¶

Bases: object

Object used to store data from a single trial (i.e., one viewing of one continuous video by one subject), with methods for operands within the trial

Parameters:path (str) – relative path to data file in which time series is stored
QC()[source]¶
center()[source]¶

Since ratings are taken on a scale of 0-2, transforms scale to be -1 to 1, i.e. center ylim around 0

fix_nan(val='interpol')[source]¶

Helper to fill occurances of NaNs in self.rating and self.time First trims tails, then retro-fills any remaining middle-wise

Parameters:val (str, float, int) – if not ‘interpol’, float or int which will replace NaNs
get_moving_average(x, w=10, mode='same')[source]¶

Builds moving average via convolution

Parameters:
  • x (numpy.array) – time-series data with shape (n_timepoints,)
  • w (int) – (Default: 5) length of window over which averages are made
lag_correct()[source]¶

During recording, skipped frames can add up to significant differences in the number of samples collected between subjects, even though the start / stop time are correct, and the sample rate generally holds true.

This method regularizes time axis values along an ARTIFICIAL new axis, such that they are equally spaced apart.

resample(sample_rate=1)[source]¶

Resamples self.rating and self.time via numpy (tail padding)

Parameters:
  • sample_rate (float) – (default 1) new sample rate (in Hz) to which data are resampled
  • new_unit – (default None) if not None, reassigns self.time_unit
scale(ylim=(-1, 1))[source]¶

Linearly scales max and min values of the rating to the respective lower and upper bounds of ylim

Parameters:ylim (tuple of type int or float) – lower and upper bound of scale
standardize()[source]¶

Normalizes rating (i.e. subtract mean) and change variange to 1
